intro: Delphinium amabile subsp. clarianum, commonly known as the Alpine larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring tall, spindly stems with whorled leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The flowers are showy, with blue to violet petals arranged in a spurred pattern, typical of the Delphinium genus. It prefers well-drained, alkaline soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
